stimulusHtml: A negatively charged metal rod briefly touches a neutral metal sphere, as shown in the figure. After the rod is removed, what is the resulting charge on the sphere and why?
choicesHtml: Negative, because electrons move from the rod to the sphere.
Negative, because protons move from the sphere to the rod.
Positive, because electrons move from the sphere to the rod.
Positive, because protons move from the rod to the sphere.
